reviews.text:
This little store is fabulous, because of its convenient spot and providing a piece of a restful corner with comfort food for young parents, especially on rainy days or hot summers with air conditioning. ‚ô•Ô∏è

Although the food pricing is comparable to or slightly higher than that of Chinese restaurants outside, it relates to low-sugar and low-salt healthy seasoning combinations, small amounts of homemade food (the cost is higher), and the cost of indoor space for toddler playing, which is truly healthy and kids-family friendly.

Compared to those general cafes, the neatness and quietness are a bit messy, but come on, it is a parent-child restaurant, so things should be a bit messy that is just right. The staff have a warm heart if you raise your requirements to them face to face.

If you do not like noise, then recommend having takeaway food & drinks, especially bubble tea is more low-sugar and healthy; if you do not mind noise and being exposed to little ones walking around, then enjoy food and a cute atmosphere in-store. üòä

I live locally and go to this cafe quite frequently. If you desire a showroom looking cafe, then this is not the place for you. This is a cafe that mums like me can feel relaxed while our kids run around and have fun in a safe environment. The toys are not fresh from the box quality, but hey, kids can still have fun playing with them. Compared to bringing kids to expensive softplays, this is a more affordable option where you can come often without breaking the banks. I always suggest this place when i am meeting up with my other mum friends. The staff and the owners are very friendly. Mia (the owner)  will spend time talking to the customers and kids when she is there. I know every business has it‚Äôs good and bad side. But overall, i love this cafe.

Just loved this cute find on the high street.
The food is reasonably priced and tasty (vanilla  milk bubble tea was great) and my 14 month old loved the toys.

The cafe is run by a lovely family who are friendly and the atmosphere feels like home away from home.

The other reviews calling it messy and dirty are being a bit dramatic - yeah it‚Äôs a bit untidy but that‚Äôs kids for you!

I was super grateful to be able to have lunch and watch my kid play without having to pay ¬£¬£¬£ like at some other soft play centres in the area.

It‚Äôs a great family cafe for kids who‚Äôll always have lots of fun with the variety of toys  and options to do something fun and for their adults, who can enjoy a little ‚Äúme time‚Äù whilst their little ones play right in front of their eyes! The place is organised with an exceptional detail to your child‚Äôs safety. And what‚Äôs very reassuring is that you often see the owners‚Äô own daughters playing there.
I‚Äôm a mom of 3 children living in Ealing and feel very privileged to have such a unique place at our doorsteps.
Certainly highly recommend!

Absolutely wonderful time. We booked there function room downstairs for my daughters 2nd birthday party and the service, and friendly warm welcome we got was absolutely the best. The transaction from beginning to the end was dealt with kindness and politeness. I would definitely book again and again. Thank you Mia and your staff.

address: 58 The Mall, London W5 3TA, United Kingdom
